item.title: Complete NHL 26 Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements And Trophies
item.content:encoded:
EA Sports is back with NHL 26, the latest installment of the long-running hockey franchise. As with any new release, NHL 26 features a number of trophies and achievements to unlock for all of the completionist who’ll boot up the game.

When it comes to sports games, earning achievements is a bit different than story-focused titles. These games reward you for winning games and championships, completing tasks in various game modes, scoring certain types of goals, and more.

So, without any more delay, let’s get into everything you need to know.

How To Get Every NHL 26 Trophy And Achievement

In total, there are 49 trophies and achievements to earn in NHL 26. The challenges range from winning a Champions Hockey League trophy in Be A Pro to simply assigning a scout to the CHL in Franchise mode. If you want to 100% the game, you’ll have to play every mode in the game, including online modes like World of Chel and Hockey Ultimate Team.

You can check out all of the trophies and how to earn them below courtesy of PSN Profiles.

NHL 26 Secret Trophies

Unlike fellow EA Sports title Madden 26, NHL 26 has no secret trophies to unlock this year. All 49 of the achievements can be seen when you load up the game on Xbox Series X|S or PlayStation 5.

How Many Achievements And Trophies Are In NHL 26?

There are 49 trophies and achievements to unlock in NHL 26.

Looking further shows that there are 34 bronze trophies, 12 silver, two gold, and one platinum trophy to unlock. Compared to NHL 25, there are two less total trophies and achievements this time around. There are four less bronze trophies, but two more silver.

As far as unlocking them is concerned, they are all pretty straight forward. Most can be done in various single-player modes. Others, however, require you to play online against other players such as winning a Ones Eliminator Tournament in the World of Chel.

Are you planning on trying to earn every achievement and trophy in NHL 26? Let us know down below and take the discussion further in the Insider Gaming forums.

For more NHL 26, check out details on the feature updates coming to the game. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Return to Silent Hill Gets Official Teaser Trailer
item.content:encoded:
Return to Silent Hill, a film adaptation of Silent Hill 2, has released the first teaser. The film, which hits theaters on January 23rd, 2026, looks to capture the magic of the iconic sequel. We had seen glimpses before last year during Silent Hill Transmission, but nothing concrete.

The film comes from director Christophe Gans, who did the original Silent Hill film in 2006. Last we had heard about Return to Silent Hill, it got its official release date of January, but no pictures or footage came of it. Regardless, we now have our first look at the upcoming adaptation, and it looks rather interesting.

Return to Silent Hill Brings Silent Hill 2 To Life in Film

In the trailer, shown above, we get a brief glimpse into the world of Return to Silent Hill. As the film is an adaptation of Silent Hill 2 (though the trailer doesn’t seem to indicate that), the plot remains the same. Protagonist James Sunderland, played by Jeremy Irvine, goes to the eerie town of Silent Hill after receiving a letter from his recently deceased wife, Laura. What follows is a bit too spoilery, but it does involve grotesque monsters and, of course, the iconic Pyramid Head. It looks like it may not be a direct adaptation, as there are a few things not from the games in it. However, it is a teaser, so expect more of a concrete plot come the full trailer.

Silent Hill 2 is widely regarded as one of the scariest games of the generation. Last year, Bloober Team and Konami released a remake of the game, which was heavily praised and was up for dozens of awards. Now, the Silent Hill series is readying the next generation with Silent Hill f, releasing on September 25th, 2025. Following that will be Bloober Team’s return with a remake of Silent Hill, announced earlier this year. Until then, fans can look forward to seeing Silent Hill 2 on the big screen in January.

Are you excited for Return to Silent Hill? What did you think of the trailer? Let us know in the comments below and on the forums!

For more on Silent Hill, check out our coverage on the Silent Hill remake’s development, as well as Silent Hill f’s leaked cutscenes. Don’t forget to subscribe to our newsletter for Insider Gaming goodness every week!

item.title: Today Was Tom McKay’s Last Day in the Kingdom Come Booth
item.content:encoded:
Tom McKay has officially wrapped his time in the booth and on the motion capture floor as Kingdom Come Deliverance’s Henry of Skalitz. In a post on social media, the Warhorse Studios team shared the news that McKay has completed his work on Kingdom Come Deliverance 2’s DLC suite, which means that after almost nine years with the character, he’s finished.

Fans were quick to jump to the conclusion that there won’t be a Kingdom Come Deliverance 3, and if there is to be another game in the series, it won’t star Henry of Skalitz.

Henry of Skalitz is Done with Kingdom Come

In a post on Twitter, the Warhorse Studios team shared a short video of Tom McKay walking into a large meeting area and being met with a round of applause from the entire squad.

As he approached, he put his hand to his heart and said:

I’m going to do my best not to cry…

Here’s the full post:

Recently, Tom McKay also called to a close his Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 streams, which were being broadcast live from Warhorse Studios’ headquarters in Prague, close to where the Kingdom Come series is set.

During the recent Opening Night Live showcase at Gamescom, Warhorse Studios announced Legacy of the Forge, the second story DLC for KCD2, which has now been on the market for more than seven months. There’s one final DLC lined up for KCD2, and it’s Mysteria Ecclesiae, which is most likely what McKay was working on before wrapping his time at Warhorse.

I’m hugely hopeful that there will be another Kingdom Come Deliverance title, as I’m a huge fan of the series and hold both the games and the actors in high regard. In 2024, I was the first person to interview Tom McKay regarding KCD2, and we had the opportunity to catch up again at the BAFTA Games Awards in April.

What’s your favorite memory of Tom McKay’s performance as Henry of Skalitz? Let me know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Baby Steps has been delayed

item.title: Microsoft Reportedly Wants King To Use AI On A Daily Basis
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft wants King employees to use AI on a daily basis.

According to a new report from mobilegamer.biz, employees at the studio behind Candy Crush were given a mandate to continually use AI for general tasks.

Sources told the outlet that AI usage was “introduced by Microsoft as mandatory a while ago”. They say that in 2024, the goal was to have “70 or 80% daily usage of AI”. That goal was pushed to 100% for 2025, meaning that “every artist, designer, developer, even managers have to use it” daily.

King was one of the studios hit hardest by Microsoft’s round of layoffs back in July, with 200 people being let go. At the time, it was revealed via an internal memo that the studio was going to “unlock” more AI tools for productivity” and that many employees will be “replaced by the AI tools they built and trained.” Those tools include ones for narrative, testing, and level design.

As far as adoption goes, one source told Mobile Gamer that “AI adoption is very low apart from ChatGPT” and that even the leadership at King is skeptical of AI’s role in the studio.

Insider Gaming has reached out to King and Microsoft regarding these claims. Should a response be received, it will be added to this story.

For more Insider Gaming, read about how Activision not having skins carry over between Call of Duty games in the name of authenticity isn’t something new. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Full NBA 2K26 Soundtrack Includes 43 Songs
item.content:encoded:
2K Sports has released the full soundtrack for NBA 2K26. Featuring 43 songs in total, this year’s soundtrack sees a mix of hip-hop and rock as well as artists both new and old.

Some of the artists include Green Day, Kendrick Lamar, Wu-Tang Clan, Cypress Hill, Doechii, and more.

You can check out the full NBA 2K26 soundtrack for yourself below. If you want to listen to it, 2K Sports has released a playlist on both Apple Music and Spotify.

NBA 2K26 launches on August 29 for those who purchases either the $100 Superstar Edition or $150 “Leave No Doubt” Edition. Those with the Standard or WNBA Edition of the game have to wait until September 5.

The game will be available on PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch 1 & 2, and PC. Gen 9 features such as ProPLAY, MyNBA, and the W are only available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Content Will no Longer Carry Forward into Black Ops 7

The proposed Black Ops 6 to Black Ops 7 carry forward is no longer happening, per a Call of Duty official statement.

Skate To Enter Early Access On September 16

It has been announced that Skate (skate.) will enter early access on September 16, following months of testing stages.

item.title: Baby Steps is Yet Another Game Delayed Due to Silksong
item.content:encoded:
Baby Steps is now the fifth game to get delayed due to Hollow Knight: Silksong. Just yesterday, indie RPG Demonschool pushed its release date to November in order to avoid Silksong. Now, even a Devolver Digital-backed game is getting out of Hornet’s way.

For those unaware, Baby Steps is the newest game from Bennett Foddy, whose games QWOP and Getting Over It provided joy and frustration to players. The challenging gameplay was a hit with both YouTubers and streamers, so, naturally, the new ambitious Baby Steps has been on many people’s radar. Unfortunately, it seems you’ll have to wait a few weeks longer to play it.

Baby Steps Throws Shade at Silksong Over Delay

Devolver Digital released a video earlier today announcing the delay of Baby Steps. The game will now release on September 23rd, 2025 instead of the slated September 8th date. In a not-so-subtle fashion, the protagonist is seen walking on a model of Hornet. As Silksong’s protagonist is Hornet, it’s obvious that the delay is, at least somewhat, due to Team Cherry’s highly anticipated spinoff.

Bennett Foddy’s Baby Steps joins five other indie titles pushed after Silksong’s surprise announcement last week. Those delayed games are as follows: CloverPit, Stomp and the Sword of Miracles, Aeterna Lucis, Demonschool, and now Baby Steps.

Hollow Knight: Silksong is one of Steam’s most wishlisted games, so it was likely that titles would avoid releasing next to it. However, due to it being September 4th, less than two weeks away, it’s caused a panic in the indie scene. As many developers have said, including Bennett Foddy before the delay, via Aftermath, gamers’ attention will all be on Silksong come next week.

Are you disappointed about Baby Steps being delayed? Was Silksong’s shadow drop too much? Let us know in the comments and on the forums!

For more on Silksong and delays, check out our articles on the preview of Silksong and Demonschool’s forward delay announcement. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter for more Insider Gaming.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: No Call of Duty Skins or Weapons Will Carry Over? Activision Has Said That Before
item.content:encoded:
In a reversal of plans, Activision has announced that Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 won’t allow weapons, operators, or operator skins to carry forward from Black Ops 6.

In a community update posted on Tuesday, Activision says that it has seen the discussion about “the identity of Call of Duty”.

“Some of you have said we’ve drifted from what made Call of Duty unique in the first place: immersive, intense, visceral and in many ways grounded,” they said. “That feedback hits home, and we take it seriously. We hear you.”

The publisher continues to say that developers Treyarch and Raven’s “north star” is to bring players a true spiritual successor to Black Ops 2. Because of that comes the decision to remove carry forward options. The publisher says the decision was ultimately made in order make Black Ops 7 “feel authentic to Call of Duty and its setting.”

Now, wanting to keep things authentic to the new game is understandable, but there’s one problem: they’ve kind of said this before.

This isn’t the first time

Ahead of the release of Black Ops 6, Activision announced that content from Modern Warfare 2 and 3 wouldn’t carry forward to the new game. At the time, they said that it was done to allow players to “experience the Black Ops universe the way it’s meant to be played.”

Again, it’s understandable. But then, it only took a few months before Black Ops 6 became filled with operators and skins such as Beavis and Butt-head, Jay and Silent Bob, Stan Smith, the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and more. All done in the name of, apparently, “keeping that signature Black Ops style.”

To give credit, reports did surface earlier this year that Activision was aware that certain skins made the game “look stupid”. Still, after that report, more skins like the American Dad crossover came out, continuing the trend.

Recently, our Tom Henderson wrote about Call of Duty executives not being worried about the competition from EA’s Battlefield 6. Sources told Henderson that many at the top believe Call of Duty is “too big to fail”. While that might be true in a sense, it seems that the reaction and interest in Battlefield 6—along with the negative reactions to the Black Ops 6 reveal—has changed some thoughts.

You’d like to think that Activision truly has listened to the community regarding the over-the-top nature of some of the operators and skins that have made their way to Call of Duty in recent years. But, then again, if these crossovers are going to continue to print money for Activision and Microsoft, how long until they pick up again with Black Ops 7? History suggests players won’t have to wait long to find out.

For more Insider Gaming, check out exclusive details on when the deal between iRacing and IndyCar came together.
